text:
Let's say I want to declare compatibility with Julia 1.0 to 1.5.x , how do I best do that?
```julia = "<= 1.5"

julia = "1.0, 1.1, 1.2, 1.3, 1.4, 1.5"```

text:
I would be down with that. that would be legit.

I also don't know that making people insert the `^` would actually help them understand.
I think it would, but I could be wrong.

text:
> I don't agree that "people are constantly getting confused",

<https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/issues/2252#issuecomment-736678006|https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/issues/2252#issuecomment-736678006>

Sounds like I  wasn't believed  that people are frequently getting confused.

Could be a question of semantics (what is the cut off for constantly? I mean certainly in a literally sense probably not true that at all times someone is confused)

text:
My idea of making ^ required was to ensure people were confused enough to read the docs and/or ask questions.
Rather than making assumptions.
